ModuleDescription:
This one-semester module covers core concepts in statistics with an emphasis on working with biomedical data. Covered topics:
- Concepts in probability
- Theory of point estimation and hypothesis testing.
- Large sample theory and maximum likelihood estimation.
- Linear models and linear algebra.
- Sampling techniques and resampling methods.
- Classification and discrimination techniques.
Prerequisite: Strong undergraduate training and background in statistics, mathematics or epidemiology.
